title: Futures point to further Wall Street gains as earnings season rolls on
text:
Futures on the Dow Jones Industrial Average YM00 rose 73 points or 0.2%, to 35206

Futures on the S&P 500 ES00 gained 13 points, or 0.3%, to 4490

Futures on the Nasdaq 100 NQ00 rose 36 points, or 0.2%, to 15327

On Monday, the Dow Jones Industrial Average DJIA fell 36 points, or 0.1%, to 35259, while the S&P 500 SPX increased 15 points, or 0.34%, to 4486, and the Nasdaq Composite COMP gained 124 points, or 0.84%, to 15022. The S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite have each seen their best four-day winning stretch since July 23.

What's driving markets

The positive backdrop comes as corporate earnings have largely overshadowed worries about supply chain disruptions.

According to Bank of America, through the first week, 66% of companies have beaten on both sales and earnings per share, which is well above the historical average of 47%.

Tuesday sees results from corporate titans including Procter & Gamble PG and Johnson & Johnson JNJ, and after the close, streaming giant Netflix NFLX.

Markets also will be eyeing the launch of the first bitcoin exchange-traded fund, and the flattening of the yield curve, as the spread between 5- BX:TMUBMUSD05Y and 30-year BX:TMUBMUSD30Y Treasury securities was the narrowest since early 2020.

Housing starts and a gaggle of Federal Reserve officials speaking highlights the day's economics calendar.
